cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to parallel or brush the east coast of Florida this weekend before curving north-northwest toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline and the Carolinas early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the east-central Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Ocean Reef FL to Sebastian Inlet FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for all of the Bahamas; Tropical-Storm Warnings for Turks & Caicos and Dominican Republic coasts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through the Carolinas, including coastal Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Sunday night into Monday with a 10% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥39 mph) winds; gusts could reach 30–40 mph in outer rainbands
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible if the center passes just offshore, mainly Monday morning
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches of rain Monday with localized heavier showers
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf, hazardous seas, and rip currents beginning late weekend; potential temporary closure of channel operations for safety
